intro: Arrostia altissima, commonly known as the tall arrostia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces showy yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
